title: Archegos's ViacomCBS Selloff Is Latest Twist for Media Firm's Investors
summary: After merger, media company's stock hit a low after 75% drop; then rose 800% to all-time high; then, in a week, lost 50%.

title: The China-Iran Axis
summary: Beijing gains influence and helps Tehran evade U.S. sanctions.. Anyone who thought the world would warm to U.S. interests once Donald Trump left the scene has received a rude awakening in the last two months. The latest sign is the weekend's pact between China and Iran, an example of U.S. adversaries uniting to advance their strategic ambitions.

title: The Myanmar Cauldron
summary: The military guns down civilians as resistance to the coup grows.. The situation in Myanmar (aka Burma) is unraveling fast. Two months ago, after losing badly in national elections, the military suspended the country's quasi-democratic government and detained its elected leader, Aung San Suu Kyi. Hopes that the coup might be peacefully reversed have been dashed, and the junta is now using violence to suppress opposition. More Western sanctions might not change the mind of the generals-especially if Russia and China arm and supply them-but solidarity with the protesters is a statement about American values.

title: Vermont Breaks the Bailout Code
summary: Montpelier now has a surplus it wants to use for union pensions.. Democrats stipulated in their $1.9 trillion spending bill that none of the $350 billion going to states and localities could be "deposited into a public pension fund." That always looked like a trick, and Vermont is the first state to prove the point.

title: New York Lawmakers Weigh Raising Taxes as Budget Deadline Looms
summary: As negotiations continue, unions push for more revenue on top of federal pandemic aid. ALBANY, N.Y.-Union leaders and Democratic state lawmakers made a final push Monday to increase taxes on the wealthy as part of a roughly $200 billion state budget due this week.

title: Notable & Quotable: Charles Hill, RIP
summary: 'The European vision is we're just going to be nice. . . . The Chinese view is why should we not do what we want?'. From the Journal's Weekend Interview with retired diplomat Charles Hill, July 28, 2012. Hill died Saturday at age 84:

title: Biden's Border Crisis, Up Close
summary: His policies endanger vulnerable migrants by encouraging them to make perilous illegal crossings.. Rio Grande Valley, Texas

title: 'Investing With Keynes' Review: Cambridge Values
summary: John Maynard Keynes was both a far-seeing economist and a shrewd investor, a savant who was undaunted by the churn of the markets.. In this frenzied moment of limitless stimulus and GameStop fever, the notion of value investing seems almost quaint. Why waste your time bargain hunting for good companies at good prices, and then wait decades for your returns to compound, when there's a snappy little ETF right there waiting to catapult you to riches in months?

title: Corkage Dilemma: A Wine-Wine Solution
summary: Restaurants need to profit, but rigid policies deter diners.. A top Miami businessman brought a 1959 Chateau Latour for a friend's birthday dinner at a prominent local Italian restaurant. He offered to buy a top champagne from the wine list so that the restaurant could earn a good profit. The manager refused, so the celebrants left and took their business elsewhere.

title: Derek Chauvin Trial Opens With Clash Over Evidence in Death of George Floyd
summary: Trial of police officer gets under way in a death that kicked off months of unrest over law enforcement's treatment of Black suspects. MINNEAPOLIS-Prosecutors said Monday that jurors should trust their eyes in the murder trial of a former police officer accused of killing George Floyd, but the defense said the case was more complicated than the viral video that sparked a wave of unrest last summer.

title: How to Bring Peace to the New Middle East
summary: Political shifts could resolve the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.. The old Middle East peace process is dead: The Israeli-Palestinian dispute no longer dominates the regional agenda. But the geopolitical changes that precipitated the demise offer the Biden administration an opportunity for a fresh approach to ending the conflict.

title: All Trump's Codependents
summary: Some of the former president's biggest critics are finding it hard to quit him.. "My predecessor. Oh God, I miss him."

title: Ship Stuck in the Suez Canal Is Freed
summary: Resume Subscription. ISMAILIA, Egypt-The vast container ship that blocked the Suez Canal for six days was freed and began moving north to an anchor point Monday, opening the critical waterway, as hopes grew that global supply delays will ease.

title: Canada Urges Halt in Use of AstraZeneca Covid-19 Vaccine in People Under 55
summary: Health officials revise guidance based on reports of blood-clotting side effects in Europe. OTTAWA-Canadian authorities recommended Monday a halt on administering the AstraZeneca PLC Covid-19 vaccine on people under the age of 55 in light of evidence from Europe on potentially serious side effects targeting younger women.

title: Senate Democrats Push for Capital-Gains Tax at Death With $1 Million Exemption
summary: Van Hollen, Sanders, Warren put details on a proposal Biden backed during campaign. WASHINGTON-Progressive Senate Democrats suggested that their new plan to tax unrealized capital gains at death should come with a $1 million per-person exemption, setting that line 10 times higher than an earlier Obama administration proposal and shielding a larger swath of upper income households.

title: Bill to Make Marijuana Legal Helps Address Unfair Past, New York City Officials Say
summary: State lawmakers are expected to vote Tuesday to legalize recreational use of the drug for adults. State legislation to legalize marijuana would bring a measure of fairness to communities that have historically borne the brunt of drug enforcement laws, New York City officials said on Monday.

title: Stocks Favored in 'Reopening Trade' Hit Turbulence
summary: A retreat in shares viewed as a play on the economic recovery highlights investor concerns about a broader decline spurred in part by tech selling. Spring hasn't been kind to stock-market highfliers.

title: Congress Extends Covid-19 Bankruptcy Relief
summary: The bipartisan legislation keeps in place bankruptcy relief for struggling borrowers and businesses. Congress extended relief measures making it easier and cheaper for small businesses to reorganize debt in chapter 11 and ensuring that individual borrowers who file bankruptcy won't have to give up their stimulus checks to pay overdue bills.

title: Pair of Covid-19 Drugs Show Promise
summary: Showing promise were an experimental therapy from Humanigen and a drug cocktail being developed by Eli Lilly, GlaxoSmithKline and Vir. A pair of experimental Covid-19 treatments produced positive results in clinical trials, the companies developing the drugs said Monday.

title: U.S. Suspends Trade Pact With Myanmar After Weekend Violence
summary: Trade representative warns U.S. could end trade preferences if attacks on protesters continue. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration condemned the Myanmar government's latest crackdown on protesters and said the U.S. was suspending relations established with the country under a 2013 trade pact after security forces there unleashed deadly violence on anticoup demonstrators over the weekend.

title: 'G_d's Pee at State's End!' by Godspeed You! Black Emperor: Soundtrack to the End of the World
summary: The Canadian rock collective layers guitars, strings and radio broadcasts in a one-of-kind project.

title: New Mideast Crude Contract May Test OPEC's Grip on Oil
summary: Abu Dhabi's Murban futures begin trading as the emirate prepares to relinquish control over prices and resales of its crude. Abu Dhabi allowed trading of a futures contract linked to its flagship grade of crude for the first time on Monday in a debut that could test OPEC's grip on oil prices.

title: WHO Report Into Covid-19 Origins Leaves Key Questions Unanswered
summary: Long-awaited report says data examined during China mission was insufficient to explain when, where and how virus began spreading. A World Health Organization-led team investigating the origins of the Covid-19 pandemic said in a report that data examined during a recent mission to China was insufficient to answer the critical questions of when, where and how the virus began spreading.

title: Supreme Court Weighs Merit of Goldman's Ethics Statements
summary: Justices consider whether generic commitments to integrity can be deemed false in the face of alleged conflicts of interest. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Monday examined whether Goldman Sachs Group Inc.'s generic assertions of corporate ethics and integrity, undermined when the company's role in the 2008 financial crisis was revealed, could expose it to a shareholder class action over false statements.

title: T-Mobile to Scale Back TV-Service Plans
summary: Wireless company to wind down skinny cable bundle next month and form YouTube TV alliance. T-Mobile US Inc. is scrapping its efforts to crack into the home television market on its own after the wireless company failed to build its skinny bundle of channels into a profitable service.

title: Stocks Waver as Banks Warn of Losses
summary: Global banks tumbled after Credit Suisse and Nomura warned that they could incur substantial losses from dealings with a U.S. client. The S&P 500 retreated from a record Monday, pressured by declines in shares of banks and technology stocks.

title: Biden's China Challenge: Counter Its Perception of American Decline
summary: Effort to demonstrate continued U.S. clout is seen in the importance the administration has placed on the Quad group. U.S. relations with China are a minefield of potentially explosive problems, yet the biggest risk is a subtle one: the danger that China overestimates the decline of U.S. power and acts accordingly.

title: Full Transcript of "Ask WSJ: Responding to Violence Against Asian-Americans"
summary: Watch the original live event by clicking on the link below. Watch the original event and sign up for future live Q&As here.

title: Who Is Derek Chauvin? Officer on Trial for Death of George Floyd
summary: First of four former officers to face trial in deadly arrest that sparked nationwide protests, debate over police treatment of Black Americans. The murder trial of Derek Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer charged in the 2020 death of George Floyd, is under way with heavy security. The circumstances of Mr. Floyd's death sparked months of protests and unrest across the country and reignited a national debate over police tactics and the treatment of Black suspects.

title: Sibilance (Tuesday Crossword, March 30)
HHS Flags Covid-19 Aid Paid to California Clinic
summary: Outpatient facility received about $81 million for treating uninsured coronavirus patients, more than all but one U.S. healthcare provider. Federal officials have flagged to investigators payments to a California outpatient clinic that received more government funds for treating uninsured Covid-19 patients than all but one medical provider in the U.S., a person familiar with the matter said.

title: Technology Keeps Senior Center Residents Connected During the Pandemic
summary: As vaccinations pick up, tech leaders look to broaden use without discouraging real-world interaction. To cope with Covid-19 restrictions, senior-living condo and apartment operators expanded digital services for residents over the past year, from video-chat apps to virtual assistants, live-stream fitness classes and virtual-reality day trips.

title: Biden to Push Offshore Wind Projects
summary: Administration moves to accelerate leasing and reviews for sea-based turbines off coasts of N.Y., N.J. and elsewhere. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration plans to give wind-power developers access to more of the Atlantic Coast and start a slate of new environmental reviews in an attempt to jump-start the country's offshore wind business.

title: Media Free Rein Has Come at a Grave Cost
summary: In the half-century since New York Times v. Sullivan was decided, increasingly emboldened and corporatized media outlets have exploited the zone of protection granted to them to stoke political and cultural partisanship and divisiveness.. Judge Laurence Silberman's courageous call for the Supreme Court to revisit the federalization of state defamation laws, and the editorial page's discussion of the issue despite its journalistic self-interest in preserving the "actual malice" barrier to legal accountability, are not only commendable-they are overdue ("Reconsidering Times v. Sullivan," March 23).

title: Gov. DeSantis's Misguided Attack on 'Elites'
summary: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is correct about one thing in his essay "What I've Learned From the Pandemic Year: Don't Trust the Elites." The problem is that he is one of them.. Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is correct about one thing in his essay "What I've Learned From the Pandemic Year: Don't Trust the Elites" (Review, March 20). The problem is that he is one of them, with degrees from Yale and Harvard Law. The publicity campaign Gov. DeSantis deemed "most damaging," namely "15 Days to Slow the Spread," was introduced by then-President Trump. Everyone at first was baffled by the coronavirus. But some were quick studies, especially after massive federal funding on vaccine creation. Others were slower to adapt than the virus itself.

title: Former GOP Sen. Kit Bond Defends Spending Earmarks
summary: If elected officials don't have a say, unelected bureaucrats will make all federal spending decisions.. Your editorial blasting appropriations earmarks overlooks the key point: If elected officials don't have a say, unelected bureaucrats will make all federal spending decisions ("Earmarks Are the GOP's Bridge to Nowhere," March 19). Even worse, these decision makers are not known to the public, they are not elected, not accountable to voters, and it is difficult, if not impossible, to hold them personally responsible.

title: More Than Ever, Writing a Memoir Is Its Own Reward
summary: I love to write, and I love to read others' stories when written from the heart-not to impress but to express.. In respectful response to Peter Funt's March 22 op-ed "An Epidemic of Memoir-Writing": I am a 78-year-old retired freelance writer working on my third memoir, after self-publishing two, purchased by a few and, as far as I know, read only by family and friends. So why am I writing a third? I love to write, and I love to read others' stories when written from the heart-not to impress but to express. Our world would be improved if we spent more time in self-reflection during this time of Covid-19.

title: Biden Says U.S. Adds Vaccine Sites, Warns Against Complacency
summary: CDC Director Rochelle Walensky describes a feeling of 'impending doom' with cases rising recently. President Biden said Monday his administration is adding new vaccine sites, as he and other officials asked Americans to keep taking precautions and the head of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention described a feeling of "impending doom" with Covid-19 cases rising recently.

title: Friendship Across Generations: Readers Tell Their Own Stories
summary: A recent Journal article on close and enduring bonds between friends 15 years or more apart in age inspired readers to respond. In a recent Wall Street Journal article "The Power of Friendship Across Generations," Clare Ansberry wrote about close friendships between people who are 15 years or more apart in age. These intergenerational friendships tend to be long-lasting and enriching. Readers responded with their own stories. Here are edited excerpts of their comments.

title: When SPACs Come Calling, 5 Things a Startup CFO Needs to Know
summary: Young companies stand to gain from the flush of cash a SPAC transaction brings in, but closing a deal involves exhaustive preparation. Finance chiefs looking to enter the public markets through a merger with a SPAC should brace themselves for a complex, nerve-racking transaction.

title: Archegos Liquidation Hit Nomura, Credit Suisse
summary: Banks' shares tumble amid pain over losses at firm run by former Tiger Asia manager Bill Hwang. A fire sale of stocks from a large U.S. investor slammed global investment banks Credit Suisse Group AG and Nomura Holdings Inc., which said they could incur substantial losses related to the trades.

title: Pfizer, Moderna Vaccines Effective in Real World, CDC Says
summary: The vaccines were 90% effective reducing the risk of infection in one of the first studies to look at real-world use in the U.S.. Covid-19 vaccines from Moderna Inc. and from Pfizer Inc. and partner BioNTech SE are highly effective in preventing infections in real-world conditions, federal health officials said, further evidence that vaccinations can slow the spread of the virus.

title: 'Our Country' by Miko Marks & the Resurrectors Review: Gospel-Galvanized Inclusivity
summary: Fourteen years after her last album, the singer-songwriter returns to recording with a genre- and industry-defying mission..

title: Progressives Would Miss the Filibuster
summary: Abolition would be shortsighted, but current rules allow obstructionists too much leeway.. Progressives are making a mistake by pushing Senate Democratic leaders to do away with the filibuster. If their agenda is worth fighting for-and it is-it's worth the inconvenience involved in confronting the threat of the filibuster and forcing the obstructors to stand up and talk for days on the Senate floor.

title: Cybersecurity Needs a New Alert System
summary: While America slowly addresses vulnerabilities in software and hardware, enemies strike.. The last successful foreign attack on multiple targets on U.S. soil wasn't 9/11. It was this past December. A cyberattack targeting software provider SolarWinds hit the U.S. government, Microsoft and cybersecurity firms such as FireEye . Unlike 9/11, the SolarWinds attack did its damage under cover of darkness. It didn't result in loss of life, but cyberattacks are extremely costly and increasing in frequency.

title: Southwest to Buy 100 New Boeing 737 MAX Jets
summary: Airline's order is boost for the plane maker, which had been hurt by a prolonged grounding and pandemic. Southwest Airlines Co. on Monday said it is buying 100 new Boeing Co. 737 MAX jets, a boost for the plane maker, which lost hundreds of orders during a prolonged grounding of the troubled jet and reduced demand for travel during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: All Work and No Play Could Make Wall Street Less Profitable
summary: Complaints about working conditions at investment banks raise some interesting questions about the sustainability of the industry's profit surge. It may only be tiny violins that most people would play for overworked junior investment bankers on Wall Street. But their concerns do raise some interesting questions for investors about the profit surge in the industry.

title: Investor Commits $100 Million to Potential Bid for Tribune Publishing
summary: Mason Slaine, a minority Tribune investor, is looking to acquire the Orlando Sentinel and the Sun Sentinel. A Florida investor has expressed interest in joining an 11th-hour effort by a Maryland hotel magnate to acquire Tribune Publishing Co. and wrest the company away from hedge fund Alden Global Capital, LLC.

title: Supreme Court to Decide if Kentucky Attorney General Can Maintain Abortion-Law Defense
summary: Republican Daniel Cameron seeks further appeals after two court rulings invalidated state curbs on second-trimester abortions.

title: First Rule of Beltway Fight Club: Companies Can't Defend Themselves
summary: Amazon commits a media sin by responding to attacks from Warren and Sanders.. The decline of media standards has apparently reached a point where it's now considered inappropriate for businesspeople to defend themselves when attacked by powerful politicians. The latest kerfuffle involving a huge left-leaning corporation and two leftist politicians makes one wonder if a conservative small-business owner even stands a chance of fair treatment in Biden's Washington.

title: National Eviction Moratorium Extended Through June
summary: Millions have fallen behind on their rent, and courts have disagreed on whether the relief is legal. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration announced a three-month extension to a national eviction moratorium, a move designed to help millions of tenants who have fallen behind on their rent even as courts have disagreed on whether the relief is legal.

title: NCAA Faces Showdown Over Player Compensation-and Future of College Sports
summary: Supreme Court hears pivotal case this week as state laws target rule-making of longtime governing body. For 115 years, the National Collegiate Athletic Association has been tightening its grip on what became the multibillion-dollar college-sports industry, with the lucrative annual men's basketball tournament as its flagship.

title: Companies Ask Customers to Help Them Cut Emissions
summary: Makers of shampoo, detergent and toothpaste are trying to tackle a major source of their carbon emissions by changing consumer habits. Take shorter showers, do laundry at cooler temperatures and turn off the tap while brushing your teeth.

title: You're Going Back to the Office. What Happens to Your Nap Habit?
summary: Resume Subscription. When high-school teacher Ryan Tibbens learned he would be resuming in-person school in March, he embarked on a mission. He wanted to continue the naps he'd been taking while working from home over the past year.

title: Online Used-Car Retailer Cazoo to Go Public in $8 Billion SPAC Deal
summary: British startup, capitalizing on a pandemic-era shift from used-car lots to the web, to list in New York. LONDON-British online car retailer Cazoo Holdings Ltd. said it would go public through a deal with a blank-check company that values the combined entity at $8.1 billion, as it capitalizes on a shift to online car buying during the pandemic.

title: Republican Senator Wants San Francisco Fed Documents on Climate and Social Work
summary: Sen. Pat Toomey said he is concerned that the new research focus of the regional Fed bank risks destabilizing the central bank's nonpolitical profile. A Republican senator, concerned that the U.S. central bank is moving beyond its congressional mandate, is asking the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco for documents on its growing focus on climate and social issues.

title: Australian Leader Demotes Lawmakers Amid Scandals
summary: Scott Morrison to establish task force on women's issues, following protests over handling of sexual-assault allegations. SYDNEY-Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison demoted two senior lawmakers as he tried to contain the political fallout from scandals that helped to bring tens of thousands of women out to protest the government's handling of sexual-assault allegations.

title: News Corp to Buy Houghton Mifflin Harcourt's Consumer-Publishing Arm
summary: After shedding noncore assets, Wall Street Journal publisher is looking to expand in strategic growth areas. News Corp has agreed to buy the consumer arm of educational publisher Houghton Mifflin Harcourt Co. for $349 million, marking the media company's second deal in less than a week.

title: Amazon-Backed Deliveroo to Price IPO at Lower End of Range
summary: Online food-delivery startup set to test investor appetite for highly competitive industry. LONDON-Deliveroo, the Amazon -backed online food-delivery service, said it would price its initial public offering at the lower end of expectations, signaling a more cautious stance even as demand has surged during the pandemic.

title: Goldman, Discovery, CM Life Sciences II: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Futures suggest U.S. stocks will open lower when markets open Monday. Here's what we're watching ahead of Monday's opening bell.

title: Investors Shouldn't Rush to Book a Sunny European Vacation
summary: Richer countries have an interest in giving priority to vaccinations over the summer tourist economy. For many European airlines-and some entire economies-much is riding on the hope that vaccination campaigns save the summer season. Too much, in fact, for investors' comfort.

title: Please Call a Doctor, I'm Rooting for Michigan
summary: Led by former Fab Five member Juwan Howard, the Wolverines are on an admirable tournament run. Go...Blue?. I can't. I can't do it. It feels like my superpower has met its Kryptonite.

title: How Meditation Helped Quarantine's Most Popular DJ, D-Nice, Play His Marathon Sets
summary: The Club Quarantine DJ also shares three songs guaranteed to get people on the dance floor, as well as his impressive vitamin routine. The first thing Derrick Jones, who goes by the stage name D-Nice, does after waking up is take his goldendoodle Charlie out for a walk. Charlie's full name is actually Charlie Quarantine, because Jones's younger daughter, Dylan, wanted the dog to have the initials CQ, to match her father's incredibly popular Instagram Live DJ series, Club Quarantine. Jones did his first Club Quarantine set in March 2020, right at the pandemic's onset. The series often draws upward of 150,000 viewers, who love joining for a humongous dance party for which they don't have to leave their houses. Celebrity guests have included Michelle Obama, Drake and Janet Jackson-plus Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders during last year's election.

title: Search for Alien Life Moves Well Beyond Mars
summary: Resume Subscription. On Mars, a robotic rover called Perseverance is searching for life from the dawn of time. Scientists, though, are looking for life signs in even stranger places, from clouds on Venus and methane lakes on Titan, to the alien atmospheres of worlds circling distant stars. They are scanning for alien radio signals, seeking signs of industrial pollution on faraway exoplanets and scrutinizing puzzling interstellar objects that have intercepted our solar system.

title: As Vaccines Flood the U.S., Covid-19 Soars Where Shots Are Scarce
summary: Resume Subscription. As rapid Covid-19 vaccine campaigns in the U.S. and some other rich countries hold the promise of a return to more normal life for their citizens, some countries, particularly poor ones, face a starkly different reality: soaring coronavirus cases, including new highs, more than a year into the pandemic.

title: Unraveling Archegos Fund Shows Risks of Investment Banking
summary: Losses at Credit Suisse and Nomura as positions at Archegos are liquidated serve as a reminder that banks' costs can come well after profits are booked. Last year investment banks made bumper profits. This year some unexpected bills are turning up.

title: In Derek Chauvin's Trial, Sides Likely to Clash Over Video
summary: The prosecution is likely to be built around images of the officer kneeling on George Floyd's neck, while the defense will seek to cast doubt with forensic and medical testimony. The prosecution and defense are set to give opening statements Monday in the trial of a former Minneapolis police officer accused of murder in George Floyd's death.

title: A U.S. Diplomat's Wife Was a Social Media Star-Until Chinese Trolls, Aided by State Media, Came After Her
summary: Tzu-i Chuang was referred to as the 'most famous diplomatic wife' before she became the target of a vicious, monthslong attack on social media. In U.S.-China diplomatic circles, Tzu-i Chuang was once referred to as the "most famous diplomatic wife" and credited with helping the U.S. score soft-power points with Chinese people at a time when few others could.

title: China, Long a Source of Deflation, Starts Raising Prices for the World
summary: Pressured by supply-chain woes and commodities costs, Chinese manufacturers are increasing prices, adding to inflation fears. HONG KONG-Rising raw-materials costs and unrelenting supply-chain constraints are prompting many Chinese exporters to increase prices for the goods they sell abroad, raising fears it may add to global inflationary pressures.

title: As Concerts Prepare to Return, Roadies Have Moved On
summary: Many stage hands and technicians have taken other jobs in the year without events, leaving a possible shortage of workers to fill the niche jobs. Artists can't wait to get back on tour, but after more than a year on pause for the Covid-19 pandemic, the live events business is facing a potential worker crisis: not enough roadies.

title: Optimistic Forecasts on Economy Might Still Be Too Dismal
summary: Economy could exceed forecasters' lofty expectations if Covid-19 crisis doesn't flare up again. Economists and policy makers have been ratcheting up their forecasts for how the U.S. economy will perform this year. But if the vaccination campaign now under way succeeds in stamping out America's Covid-19 crisis, those forecasts could still be too low.

title: China's Tech Giants Have Chip Ambitions, Too
summary: Beijing pours billions semiconductor sector, but private-sector companies also have incentive to invest. China has pushed hard to be self-sufficient in semiconductors, and state-backed chip firms have raised huge sums. But Beijing's ambitions will ultimately depend on the country's vibrant private sector, too.

title: Biden Has First Shot at Judicial Vacancies
summary: Judges have retired or taken senior status, opening the way for the president to put his stamp on the judiciary. President Biden has the first chance to put his stamp on the federal judiciary as dozens of federal judges have stepped down from active duty in recent months.

title: SPACs Are the Stock Market's Hottest Trend. Here's How They Work.
summary: Hundreds of blank-check firms are doing deals or are on the hunt for companies to take public. SPACs are the investment of the moment. With interest rates on the floor and investors chasing young companies, this is a dream scenario for SPACs. To know what's next and how the boom will end, investors need to understand these quirky financial concoctions.

title: Coronavirus Was Supposed to Drive Bankruptcies Higher. The Opposite Happened.
summary: Stimulus checks and other government measures kept many borrowers from bankruptcy last year despite high unemployment, but economists worry it won't last. The number of people seeking bankruptcy fell sharply during the pandemic as government aid propped up income and staved off housing and student-loan obligations.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Turning In (Monday Crossword, March 29)
We Live in a New Age of Email Anxiety
summary: It's so basic, yet can turn into a huge source of stress for people at work-here's what to do about it. They linger at the bottom of Meg Keene's inbox in the urgent bold of the unread.
